author: Pastor Davidson Dias de Freitas
title: MENSAGEM PASTORAL – Salmo 34:08 – O Senhor É Bom; Bem-Aventurado O Homem Que Nele Se Refugia – Autor: Pastor Davidson D Freitas – 01 de junho de 2024
text:
O SENHOR É BOM; BEM-AVENTURADO O HOMEM QUE NELE SE REFUGIA. – 01JUN24.
TEXTO: Salmo 34:08.
08 Provai, e vede que o senhor é bom; bem-aventurado o homem que nele se refugia.”
Neste Salmo Davi nos exorta em confiar em Deus. O Deus de sempre está pronta para nos ajudar a resolver nossos problemas e melhor direcionar a nossa vida.
Provai é um termo, na forma imperativa, que determina a todos nós, crentes em Jesus Cristo, buscar no Senhor Deus ajuda e refrigério todos os dias.
Quais são as suas necessidades hoje? Enfermidades incuráveis pela medicina; dificuldades no casamento ou nos relacionamentos; dívidas impagáveis; desemprego; problemas físicos e espirituais etc etc etc.
Não importa o tamanho do seu problema, pois Deus é suficientemente grande para superá-lo. Basta somente que você creia que Ele está pronto para resolvê-lo, necessitando que você se refugie n’Ele. Refugiar em Deus é ficar, literalmente, sobre as Suas asas, permanecer sob elas durante as tempestades do dia a dia. Problemas nós teremos sempre, mas a solução deles depende de nossas escolhas.
Se você está achando que tudo isto é blá, blá, blá é porque você ainda não experimentou PROVAR e REFUGIAR-SE em Deus. Está faltando fé e, talvez, mais paciência em você, pois CONFIAR em Deus é ter certeza que Ele resolverá todos os seus problemas, no momento oportuno.
O que você precisa fazer para receber tudo isto de Deus?
Basta estar em comunhão com Ele, amando-O e reconhecendo que Seu filho, Jesus Cristo, é seu único Senhor e Salvador de sua vida. Que o Senhor Jesus já pagou o preço para que pudéssemos usufruir dessas bênçãos.
Lembre-se: “Esperei com paciência no Senhor, e ele se inclinou para mim, e ouviu o meu clamor.” Salmo 40:1.
Que as bênçãos do Senhor permaneçam nos abençoando.
Pastor Davidson D Freitas, AUTOR.

title: Petes Announce Whiteout for Home Opener on September 26
text:
Petes Announce Whiteout for Home Opener on September 26
The Peterborough Petes are asking fans who are attending the Home Opener on Thursday, September 26 to wear white to the game to create a whiteout in the stands. The game will take place at the Peterborough Memorial Centre (PMC) with puck drop scheduled for 7:05 p.m.
The Petes will begin the season against the rival Kingston Frontenacs for the second consecutive campaign. In 2023, Peterborough opened the year with a 5-4 come from behind victory over the Frontenacs in front of a sold-out crowd at the PMC.
Fans are encouraged to wear white for Thursday’s game. Petes 2024 Whiteout Tees are available now through the Petes Store and can be purchased by clicking
here, or by visiting the Petes Store during business hours.
Limited tickets are still available for the Home Opener and can be purchased by clicking
https://tickets.memorialcentre.ca/Online/default.asp, calling (705) 743-3561, or by visiting the Grant Thornton Box Office during business hours. Fans are encouraged to act now to ensure they secure the best seats possible. A very limited number of season tickets are still available for the 2024-25 season. Interested fans can Contact Tyler Hall by
The Petes are back in action on Saturday, September 21 when they host the Guelph Storm at the Cavan Monaghan Community Centre in Millbrook. Puck drop is scheduled for 7:05 p.m. Ticket details can be found by clicking
https://chl.ca/ohl-petes/article/ticket-details-announced-for-petes-vs-storm-preseason-game-in-millbrook/. The game will also be streamed live on the Petes official YouTube page. Stay tuned to the Petes social media channels and website for season updates as they become available.

author: Kyla Pearce kyla.pearce@denvergazette.com
title: Aurora arborist keeps city safe, clean from tree tops | Aurora | denvergazette.com
text: Ashley Fox can often be found high atop trees, swinging from branch to branch with a chainsaw attached to her hip, a big smile on her face and a shirt covered in bark and wood chips. Fox is a climbing arborist for the city of Aurora and spends her days keeping the city trees safe and beautiful for area residents. Prior to working for the city, Fox didn't know anything about tree climbing or tree work, she said. What she did have, however, was a degree in natural resources and an enthusiasm for all things outdoors. In her interview for the role — which at the time was an apprenticeship — Fox flew to Aurora to show the interviewers that she could climb 25 feet and go up in a bucket truck without issue. Now, she prides herself in providing tree work, which can be expensive and often inaccessible to people due to the cost, to Aurora residents to make the city's canopy safe and beautiful for everybody. "Being able to have tree work be accessible for everybody in the city and not having one extra thing to worry about ... is definitely the best, most fulfilling part of the job," Fox said. Trees provide a multitude of important services to cities, she said, including shade that can create an 11 degree difference in temperature, habitats for wildlife, beautification of neighborhoods and oxygen. "There are so many ecosystem services that trees provide," Fox said. Her team's rule of thumb is to prune dead branches, which they can check for by looking for green underneath the bark of a branch and buds or leaves during certain seasons, and to cut branches two inches or bigger around, she said. "Our scope is called safety pruning, so we're making sure that anything that would hurt somebody if it were to fall, we get that out," Fox said. They also do clearance, which means cutting branches lower than 14 feet over the street, eight feet over sidewalks and six feet over yards. Structure pruning makes sure trees don't have structural defaults as they age. When storms roll through the area, her team also handles storm damage, she said, with somebody on call 24/7 to clear roadways, sidewalks and driveways of fallen branches. The team should have plenty of work after Thursday's snowstorm dumped several inches of heavy, wet snow on Aurora. Fox recalled a storm in May a few years ago when she was called in at 3 a.m. to clear a fallen tree on Chambers Road that was too big for plows to move. Fox is part of a small percentage of the arborist industry that is women. She encouraged more women to get involved in the work she does. In her time with the city, she's learned that women can do anything men can do, albeit sometimes women have to get more creative, she said. "I've got this awesome hook that I can hook onto logs and I can use mechanical advantage for moving things around that maybe someone who's bigger than me can Hulk around," Fox said. "I've learned different unique ways that help me climb better ... I think women would have a lot of fun climbing trees with us." On one occasion, Fox recalled getting down from the tree and meeting a curious city resident, who asked in surprise if she was a girl. In addition to being a woman in a male-dominated space, Fox's strengths as an arborist include her background in biology. Knowing the science behind the trees she works on helps her identify them, make smarter cuts and put more thought behind how she works with the trees. The bigger the tree, the better, Fox said when asked if she had a favorite type to work on. But all trees are unique and have different features that change how they're worked on. "When I think about an elm tree, the wood is going to be strong," she said, pointing to an Elm then a Hackberry. "Versus this Hackberry over here, that's really flexible wood and it's going to be more fibrous ... it's been interesting climbing over the years and being able to notice the difference between the different trees and how they respond." Her favorites to climb are Ash and Elm trees, she said, because their branches are long and they "can grow in funkier ways," making limb walks more exciting. In her off time, Fox participates in tree climbing competitions through the International Society of Arboriculture, she said. Competitions include climbing the rope as quickly as she can, tossing a weighted bow into the tree to test aim, setting up and participating in aerial rescue, and other events that test the skills she uses daily at work. While Fox loves the physical part of her job, her passion for helping city residents access tree work keeps her climbing. "I don't think it would be accessible for everybody because of how expensive it is," Fox said. "So I'm definitely happy with this work."

author: Роман Софин
title: Как пенсионерке вернули 100 тысяч рублей от мошенников? - nsk.om1.ru
text:
Прокуратура Усть-Таркского района добилась возврата 100 тысяч рублей 66-летней пенсионерке, которая стала жертвой телефонных мошенников. Пенсионерка перевела свои сбережения злоумышленникам под влиянием обмана. Прокурор района подал иск о взыскании средств.
«Следствием установлено лицо, которому были переведены денежные средства, — 25-летний житель Воронежской области. Решением Калачеевского районного суда Воронежской области требования прокурора были полностью удовлетворены», — сообщается в ведомстве.
Суд постановил взыскать с получателя денежных средств всю украденную сумму в пользу пострадавшей.
Ранее жителям Новосибирска рекомендовали с осторожностью относиться к хранению личной информации в смартфонах, включая фотографии документов, пароли и приватные снимки, что может привести к серьёзным последствиям в случае утери устройства или взлома.

author: Newsmeter Network
title: Kavach 4.0: All you want to know about new indigenous railway safety system
text:
New Delhi: Indian Railways has commissioned the indigenous safety system `Kavach 4.0' on the Mathura-Kota section of the high-density Delhi-Mumbai route. “Railways has indigenously designed, developed, and manufactured the Kavach Automatic Train Protection System, taking inspiration from PM Narendra Modi's ‘Atmanirbhar Bharat’ vision. Kavach 4.0 is a technology-intensive system. It was approved by the Research Designs & Standards Organisation (RDSO) in July 2024. Many developed nations took 20-30 years to develop and install train protection systems. The commissioning of Kavach 4.0 on the Kota-Mathura section has been achieved in a very short timeframe. This is a very big achievement,” said Ashwini Vaishnaw, Union Minister for Railways.Kavach System :Advanced Train protection systems of international standard were not installed in the country in the last 60 years after independence. To ensure train and passenger safety, the Kavach system has recently been operationalized.Indian Railways is gearing up to commission Kavach 4.0 on various routes throughout the country within a short span of 6 years. Over 30,000 people have already been trained on Kavach systems. IRISET (Indian Railway Institute of Signal Engineering and Telecommunications) has signed an MoU with 17 AICTE-approved Engineering colleges, institutions, and universities for incorporating Kavach as part of their BTech course curriculum. Kavach will help the loco pilots in maintaining train speed by effective brake application. Even in low visibility conditions like fog, the loco pilots will not have to look outside the cabin for a signal. Pilots can see the information on the dashboard installed inside the cab.What is Kavach?● Kavach is an indigenously developed train safety system. It is designed to prevent accidents by monitoring and controlling train speeds.● It is designed at Safety Integrity Level 4 (SIL 4). This is the highest level of safety design.● Development of Kavach started in 2015. The system was extensively tested for over 3 years.● After technical improvements, the system was installed in South Central Railway (SCR). The first operational certificate was granted in 2018.● Based on the experiences gained in SCR, an advanced version, ‘Kavach 4.0’, was developed. It was approved in May 2025 for speeds up to 160 kmph.● Kavach components are being manufactured indigenously. Complexity of Kavach :Kavach is an extremely complex system. Commissioning of Kavach is equivalent to setting up a telecom company. It includes the following sub-systems:RFID tags: Installed at every 1 km along the entire length of the track. Tags are also installed at every signal. These RFID tags provide the precise location of the trains.Telecom Towers: Full-fledged telecom towers, including optical fiber connectivity and power supply, are installed across the track length every few kilometers. Kavach systems installed on locos and Kavach controllers at the stations are constantly communicating using these towers. It is equivalent to installing a complete network like that of a telecom operator.Loco Kavach: It interacts with the RFID tags installed on the tracks and relays the information to telecom towers and receives radio information from Station Kavach. Loco Kavach is also integrated with the braking system of the locomotives. This system ensures that the brakes are applied in case of an emergency.Station Kavach: Installed at every station and block section. It receives information from the Loco Kavach and signaling system and guides the Loco Kavach for safe speeds.Optical Fibre Cable (OFC): Optical fiber is laid along the tracks that connect all these systems for high-speed data communication.Signalling system: The Signalling system is integrated with the Loco Kavach, Station Kavach, telecom towers, etc.These systems need to be installed, checked, and certified without disrupting the railway operations, including heavy movement of passenger and goods trains.Indian Railways invests more than INR 1 lakh crore per year in safety-related activities. Kavach is one of the many initiatives taken to enhance the safety of passengers and trains. The progress made and the pace of deployment of Kavach reflect the commitment of Indian Railways towards ensuring railway safety.

author: jacob Maslow
title: Effective Strategies for Team Building and Fostering a Positive Work Environment
text:
Making a positive work environment and developing solid group dynamics are basic components of a flourishing work environment. In this guide to effective group-building strategies, we dive into noteworthy bits of knowledge to cultivate a positive environment inside your team. Drawing motivation from the mastery of Adventure Games Inc , a trailblazer in innovative team-building approaches, we investigate strategies that not only reinforce interpersonal connections but also contribute to a harmonious and productive work environment. Join us on this journey as we reveal practical strategies to improve collaboration, communication, and overall workplace positivity.
Clear Communication for Productive Collaboration When team members are able to successfully pass on their thoughts, contemplations, and concerns, it upgrades the overall efficiency and proficiency of the group. Clear communication includes not just talking clearly, but moreover effectively listening to others, asking clarifying questions, and giving valuable criticism.
Moreover, utilizing different communication channels such as face-to-face meetings, emails, and extended management can also help guarantee that imperative information is shared in a timely way and that everybody is on the same page. By advancing and practicing clear communication, groups can cultivate a positive work environment where collaboration can thrive, and objectives can be accomplished effectively.
Empowering Diversity for Imaginative Ideas Recognizing the value of differing qualities inside a team is fundamental for cultivating innovative thoughts and accomplishing victory in today’s dynamic work environment . By bringing together people with diverse foundations, experiences, and points of view, teams can tap into an endless pool of imagination and problem-solving abilities that will stay undiscovered. Empowering differing qualities implies effectively looking for people from different genders, ethnicities, ages, and social foundations, and making an comprehensive environment where their voices are listened and valued.
Research has reliably shown that diverse groups are more likely to come up with groundbreaking ideas and solutions as they bring distinctive ways of considering and interesting approaches to the table. Embracing diversity is not just a moral imperative but also a savvy business choice that can lead to increased development and competitive advantage in today’s worldwide marketplace.
Encouraging Continuous Learning and Development
An essential aspect of fostering a positive work environment is the commitment to continuous learning and development among team members. Encouraging employees to expand their skills and knowledge not only benefits them individually but also enhances the overall capabilities of the team.
Managers can support this by providing access to training programs, workshops, and educational resources relevant to their roles and career aspirations. Additionally, establishing mentorship programs where seasoned team members can share their expertise with newer colleagues fosters a culture of knowledge sharing and collaboration. By investing in the growth and development of employees, organizations demonstrate their commitment to their team members’ success and contribute to a more dynamic and innovative work environment.
Promoting Work-Life Balance for Well-being
Maintaining a healthy work-life balance is crucial for the well-being and productivity of employees. Organizations can promote this balance by implementing policies that support flexible working hours, telecommuting options, and paid time off for vacations and personal pursuits.
Encouraging employees to disconnect from work during non-business hours and providing resources for managing stress and burnout also contribute to a positive work environment. When employees feel supported in managing their personal and professional responsibilities, they are more likely to be engaged, motivated, and satisfied with their work.
By prioritizing work-life balance, organizations demonstrate their commitment to the holistic well-being of their employees and create an environment where individuals can thrive both personally and professionally.
Fostering a Culture of Innovation and Risk-taking
Embracing a culture of innovation and risk-taking is essential for staying competitive and adapting to changing market dynamics. Organizations can cultivate this culture by encouraging creativity, experimentation, and the exploration of new ideas.
Leaders can set the tone by openly recognizing and rewarding innovative thinking, even if it results in failure. Creating forums for brainstorming and collaboration, such as regular ideation sessions or innovation challenges, empowers employees to contribute their ideas and solutions to organizational challenges.
Moreover, providing resources and support for implementing innovative projects demonstrates a commitment to turning ideas into tangible results. By fostering a culture where calculated risks are encouraged and celebrated, organizations can unleash the full potential of their teams and drive continuous improvement and growth.
Supporting Trust Through Open Communication One successful procedure for supporting trust is through open communication. When team members feel comfortable communicating their considerations, concerns, and concepts openly and truly, it makes an environment of transparency and shared regard. This could be accomplished by empowering dynamic listening, giving openings for everybody to contribute, and advancing a secure space where people feel listened and upheld.
Additionally, establishing clear channels of communication, such as customary group gatherings and open-door approaches, can encourage upgraded trust and guarantee that data streams openly all throughout the group. By prioritizing open communication, groups can fortify their connections, upgrade efficiency, and eventually accomplish more noteworthy success.
Enabling Group Members for Success To empower team members for victory, it is essential to cultivate a culture of independence and trust. Rather than micromanaging, provide your group with the freedom to form choices and take proprietorship of their work.
Energize them to set objectives and provide them with the fundamental assets and back to attain those objectives. Recognize and celebrate their accomplishments, both huge and little, to boost assurance and inspiration.
Enabling group members moreover includes designating errands and obligations based on their qualities and mastery, permitting them to grandstand their aptitudes and develop professionally. By giving your group the certainty and independence to exceed expectations in their parts, you not only develop a sense of strengthening but also cultivate a more productive and fruitful work environment.
Celebrating Victories as a Team By recognizing achievements, you not only validate the difficult work and devotion of people but also cultivate a sense of camaraderie and solidarity inside the group. Celebrating triumphs can take different shapes, such as organizing team excursions, facilitating grant ceremonies, or basically recognizing accomplishments amid group gatherings.
These moments of celebration give an opportunity to boost group assurance, rouse inspiration, and strengthen the esteem of collective endeavors. Grasping a culture of celebration not only makes a positive work environment but also encourages continued development and victory for the complete team.

Conclusion In today’s fast-paced and competitive work environment, it is vital for groups to have solid bonds and a positive work culture. By actualizing successful group-building techniques such as communication, trust building, and recognizing individual qualities, organizations can foster a cohesive group and eventually progress in general efficiency and success.
It is critical for pioneers to prioritize group building and create a positive work environment to guarantee the victory of their group and organization. With these methodologies in place, groups can overcome challenges and accomplish their objectives together.
